Maarten Luther Gouda, The Netherlands
Professional Experience:
September 2012 – now
Business Development Manager for Green Oleo
Responsible for sales in Europe (not Italy, Spain and Portugal ) sales in Asia and China (agents).
Maintaining customer relationships and developing new business.
October 2012 – September 2012:
Area Sales Manager Benelux and Germany for MBP Group
Responsible for sales of by-products to the biogas, bio-fuel and energy market.
Finding alternative outlets for waste products as Dutch waste broker.
2010 - 2012:
Area Sales Manager Benelux Industrial Chemicals for Croda Chemicals
Responsible for sales in the Benelux, including key accounts in Germany and the key-account MBP/Croda.
2007 – 2010
Supply Chain Manager Europe for Unichema BV Gouda (part of Croda Chemicals)
Short term planning (3 months forecast) for the four European oleochemical production sites in the Netherlands, Germany, England and Italy.
Once a month long-term planning based on sales forecast, current contracts, raw materials and stocks.
Weekly meetings with the site supply chain manager regarding purchasing, sales and production issues.
1995 – 2006
Production planner for Unichema Chemie BV Gouda (part of ICI Group)
Using the 3 month forecast and daily order acceptance for production schedule update including reallocation when production issues occurred.
1991 – 1995
First Analyst for Unichema Chemie BV Gouda (part of Unilever)
Head of the analytical quality control team Gouda.
Quality control raw materials, intermediates, production and finished products.
1988 – 1991
Analyst for Unichema Chemie BV Gouda (part of Unilever)
Quality control of raw materials, intermediate, production and finished products.
Business courses / Workshops / Additional education:
2012:		Waste broker exam (passed)
2011:		German sales course (3 days)
2003 – 2005:	‘Bacon’ Supply Chain Projectteam
2000 – 2002:	‘Helix’ Integration SAP Projectteam
1998:	Installation of ‘Fygir’ scheduling tool (for production planning Gouda)
1996:		Production control and material management (Unilever course)
1995:		First Aid exam (passed)

Dutch (native)
English (fluent)
German (fluent)
Computer skills:
Good knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, SAP and Navision.
Hobbies:
Tennis, jogging and cycling.

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
